definition: Alexandre Dumas, père (1802-1870), French writer
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
second month of a season/middle/intermediate/second amongst brothers
surname Zhong
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: Dumas and his son are often referred to as Dumas peré (father) and Dumas fils (son).
sentences.chinese: 他们通常被人们称为大仲马和小仲马。

sentences.english: Alexandre Dumas is one of the most widely-read writers in the world.
sentences.chinese: 大仲马是世界上读者最多的作家之一。

sentences.english: The ballet is based on this version by Dumas.
sentences.chinese: 而该芭蕾舞剧使用的就是大仲马改编的版本。

sentences.english: Dumas kept the Republican political views, against the monarchy.
sentences.chinese: 大仲马信守共和政见，反对君主专政。

sentences.english: The French writer Alexandre Dumas later rewrote Hoffman's story.
sentences.chinese: 法国作家大仲马后来改写了霍夫曼的故事。

sentences.english: Alexandre Dumas has given a new annotation to love.
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大仲马给了爱情一个全新的诠释。

sentences.english: Alexandre Dumas is one of the best popular historical novelists in France.
sentences.chinese: 大仲马是法国著名的历史通俗小说家。

definition: Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
Victor Hugo (1802-1885), French writer
Gustave Flaubert (1821-1880), French realist novelist, author of Madame Bovary
Guy de Maupassant (1850-1893), French novelist and short story writer
Stendhal
Prosper Mérimée (1803-1870), French scholar and writer, author of novel Carmen on which Bizet based his opera
Marcel Proust (1871-1922), French author
Fyodor Mikhailovich Dostoevsky (1821-1881), great Russian novelist, author of Crime and Punishment 罪與罰|罪与罚[Zui4 yu3 Fa2]
pinyin: Tuo2 si1 tuo3 ye1 fu1 si1 ji1

definition: Shakespeare (name)/William Shakespeare (1564-1616), poet and playwright
Maugham (family name)/W. Somerset Maugham (1874-1965), English writer
Tolstoy (name)/Count Lev Nikolayevich Tostoy (1828-1910), great Russian novelist, author of War and Peace 戰爭與和平|战争与和平
Ivan Sergeevich Turgenev (1818-1883), Russian novelist
Cervantes/abbr. for 米格爾·德·塞萬提斯·薩維德拉|米格尔·德·塞万提斯·萨维德拉[Mi3 ge2 er3 · de2 · Sai1 wan4 ti2 si1 · Sa4 wei2 de2 la1]
Anton Pavlovich Chekhov (1860-1904), Russian writer famous for his short stories and plays
James Joyce (1882-1941), Irish modernist writer, author of Ulysses and Finnegans Wake
pinyin: Zhan1 mu3 si1 · Qiao2 yi1 si1

definition: Molière (1622-1673), French playwright and actor, master of comedy
